titleInfo.title: Letter from Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay, to Lieutenant William Bruce, Acting Resident, Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter encloses an extract of a letter, dated 6 June 1810, from the Court of Directors, Commercial Department of the East India Company. The extract concerns the woollen trade in Persia. It rejects Bruce's proposal that the Company should follow Russia's example and accept Persian goods as an alternative to cash, and questions Bruce's knowledge and judgement.
